title: Ticket #3068: Bad example in documentation for per daemon knobs
description:
In section 3.3.1.2 Configuration File Macros we have the following as examples of valid per daemon configuration knobs:

MASTER.LOWPORT = 20000

MASTER.HIGHPORT = 20100

NEGOTIATOR.LOWPORT = 22000

NEGOTIATOR.HIGHPORT = 22100

The only ones with any chance of succeeding are the MASTER.*PORT knobs, as master is the one that creates ports for the child daemons and passes it on to them to use. As such, the master daemon will ignore the NEGOTIATOR.*PORT options and users will see the negotiator attaching to ports in what they thought they specified as the master's range. The lines above the example sought to explain the usage of daemon specific knobs and provide a use case. I'm actually not aware of any good alternative use cases to replace that example with.
remarks:
